title: tPA (Tissue Plasminogen Activator) Contraindications for Ischemic Stroke
description: Evaluates eligibility and contraindications for thrombolytic therapy with IV tPA in acute ischemic stroke patients. Reviews absolute and relative contraindications based on AHA/ASA guidelines.

parameters.name: ischemic_stroke_within_3_months
parameters.description: History of ischemic stroke within 3 months

parameters.name: gi_malignancy_bleeding_21_days
parameters.description: GI malignancy or GI bleeding within 21 days

parameters.name: thrombin_factor_xa_inhibitors
parameters.description: Current use of direct thrombin or factor Xa inhibitors

parameters.name: ct_hypodensity_one_third
parameters.description: CT shows multilobar infarction (hypodensity >1/3 cerebral hemisphere)

parameters.name: aortic_dissection
parameters.description: Known or suspected aortic arch dissection

parameters.name: neoplasm_increased_bleeding
parameters.description: Intracranial neoplasm with increased bleeding risk

parameters.name: minor_symptoms
parameters.description: Only minor and non-disabling stroke symptoms

parameters.name: seizure_at_onset
parameters.description: Seizure at onset with postictal neurological impairments

parameters.name: major_surgery_14_days
parameters.description: Major surgery or serious trauma within 14 days

parameters.name: gi_hemorrhage_21_days
parameters.description: Recent GI or urinary tract hemorrhage within 21 days

parameters.name: mi_within_3_months
parameters.description: Recent acute myocardial infarction within 3 months

ranges.interpretation: Patient is eligible for IV tPA administration. Proceed with standard dosing (0.9 mg/kg, maximum 90 mg, with 10% as bolus over 1 minute and remainder infused over 60 minutes).

ranges.description: One or more absolute contraindications present
ranges.interpretation: IV tPA is contraindicated due to unacceptable bleeding risk. Consider mechanical thrombectomy if large vessel occlusion is present and patient meets criteria.

ranges.description: One or more relative contraindications present
ranges.interpretation: Carefully weigh risks and benefits. Consider consultation with stroke specialist. Document informed consent discussion if proceeding with tPA.

references: Powers WJ, Rabinstein AA, Ackerson T, Adeoye OM, Bambakidis NC, Becker K, et al. Guidelines for the Early Management of Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke: 2019 Update to the 2018 Guidelines for the Early Management of Acute Ischemic Stroke: A Guideline for Healthcare Professionals From the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association. Stroke. 2019 Dec;50(12):e344-e418.
Hacke W, Kaste M, Bluhmki E, Brozman M, Dávalos A, Guidetti D, et al. Thrombolysis with alteplase 3 to 4.5 hours after acute ischemic stroke. N Engl J Med. 2008 Sep 25;359(13):1317-29.

Jauch EC, Saver JL, Adams HP Jr, Bruno A, Connors JJ, Demaerschalk BM, et al. Guidelines for the early management of patients with acute ischemic stroke: a guideline for healthcare professionals from the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association. Stroke. 2013 Mar;44(3):870-947.
formula: Assessment of absolute and relative contraindications based on AHA/ASA guidelines
notes: This tool evaluates contraindications for IV tPA (alteplase) in acute ischemic stroke
Time window is critical: standard window is within 3 hours, extended window 3-4.5 hours with additional exclusions
Absolute contraindications represent unacceptable bleeding risk
Relative contraindications require careful risk-benefit analysis
Blood pressure must be <185/110 mmHg before and during treatment
Always verify current institutional protocols and guidelines
